import React, { useState } from 'react'; import './InfoPanel.css'; const InfoPanel = ({ selectedNode, textSize, circleSize, onTextSizeChange, onCircleSizeChange }) => { const [activeTab, setActiveTab] = useState('about'); const handleTextSizeChange = (e) => { onTextSizeChange(parseInt(e.target.value)); }; const handleCircleSizeIncrease = () => { onCircleSizeChange(circleSize + 70); }; const handleCircleSizeDecrease = () => { onCircleSizeChange(circleSize - 70); }; return (

Empires In Prophecy

  • setActiveTab('bible')} style={{ cursor: 'pointer' }} > Texts
  • setActiveTab('about')} style={{ cursor: 'pointer' }} > About
  • setActiveTab('settings')} style={{ cursor: 'pointer' }} > Settings
  • setActiveTab('instructions')} style={{ cursor: 'pointer' }} > How To
{/* Bible Texts Tab */}
Click on a verse to see it here.
{selectedNode ? (
{selectedNode.key || selectedNode.name}

Selected node: {selectedNode.name}

{/* Here you would display the actual Bible texts related to the selected node */}
) : (

No node selected. Click on a node in the visualization to see related texts.

)}
{/* About Tab */}

Empires In Prophecy

Studying Daniel and Revelation

When we couple the prophecies in Daniel and Revelation with the pattern of prophetic words throughout the bible, we can learn to interpret bible prophecy properly. To do this, we use the bible alone to interpret itself.


Biblical self interpretation has been the goal of this software since the beginning. So we can see a map of the interpretations.

"But know this first of all, that no prophecy of Scripture is a matter of one's own interpretation".'

2nd Peter 1:20

I will write about the subject map soon (march 2019)


{/* Settings Tab */}
Text Size
Circle Size
{/* Instructions Tab */}
   

Pan and zoom to your hearts content.
Use Settings to adjust radius and text size.


These are Hierarchical Relationships
  • Blue Text is the Selected Item
    1. Green lines show what belongs to the Selected Item.
      • 1a. Green lines + Red Items show mutual ownership.
    2. Blue lines show what the Selected Item belongs to.

Use the bible tab to see the texts.

); }; export default InfoPanel;
